Value: úⁿdɣu
ŋnɔ́sɔ
ɔŋɔɛ̀ɲɛ
Comment_contributor: there are two words for two; in all subsequent numbers, either word can be used interchangeably.

Value: ŋɲúŋku
ɔ́pŋɔ aⁿtána
Comment_contributor: lit. 'leave out the thumb'

Value: pɔ̀pɔ úⁿdɣu (it͡ʃìsi)
Comment_contributor: lit. 'one hand [together]'

Value: pɔ̀pɔ úⁿdɣu it͡ʃìni nàŋna ana eke úⁿdɣu
Comment_contributor: litː 'one hand together and one on the other’
Comment_glosser: ‘hand one together other? on? that? one’ (?)

Value: pɔ́pɔ úⁿdɣu it͡ʃìni nàŋna ana eke ŋnɔ́sɔ
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘one hand together and two on the other’

Value: pɔ́pɔ úⁿdɣu it͡ʃìni nàŋna ana eke ŋɲúŋku
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘one hand together and three on the other’

Value: pɔ́pɔ úⁿdɣu it͡ʃìni nàŋna ana eke ɔ́pŋɔ aⁿtána
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘one hand together and four on the other’

Value: pɔ́pɔ ŋnɔ́sɔ it͡ʃìsi
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘two hands together’

Value: pɔ́pɔ ŋnɔ́sɔ it͡ʃìni ɔmkrɔ̀ᵐbɔ ana eke úⁿdɣu
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘two hands together and one on the foot’ (there are two words for ‘foot’ that can be used in counting, /ɔmkrɔ̀ᵐbɔ/ and /omkrèᵐbe/; in all subsequent numbers, either word can be used interchangeably.)
Comment_glosser: ‘hand two together foot on? that? one’ (?)

Value: pɔ́pɔ ŋnɔ́sɔ it͡ʃìni ɔmkrɔ̀ᵐbɔ ana eke ŋnɔ́sɔ
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘two hands together and two on the foot’

Value: pɔ́pɔ ŋnɔ́sɔ it͡ʃìni ɔmkrɔ̀ᵐbɔ ana eke ŋnɔ́sɔ
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘two hands together and two on the foot’

Value: pɔ́pɔ ŋnɔ́sɔ it͡ʃìni ɔmkrɔ̀ᵐbɔ ana eke ɔ́pŋɔ aⁿtána
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘two hands together and four on the foot’

Value: pɔ́pɔ ŋnɔ́sɔ ɔmkrɔ̀ᵐbɔ úⁿdɣu it͡ʃìsi
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘two hands and one foot together’

Value: pɔ́pɔ ŋnɔ́sɔ ɔmkrɔ̀ᵐbɔ úⁿdɣu it͡ʃìni ɔmkrɔ̀ᵐbɔ ɨⁿdɣɨ ana eke úⁿdɣu
Comment_contributor: lit. ‘two hands and one foot together and one on the other foot’
Comment_glosser: ‘hand two foot one together foot other? on? that? one’ (?)
